resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: arrow java build broken on trusty

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
pravindra commented on issue #3472: ARROW-4358: [WIP] Skip updating mvn
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3472#issuecomment-457278850
 
 
   I'm hitting this error in CI for trusty. Any idea what could be wrong ?
   
   /usr/bin/ld: /home/travis/build/apache/arrow/cpp-toolchain/lib/libdouble-conversion.a(double-conversion.cc.o): unrecognized relocation (0x29) in section `.text'
   /usr/bin/ld: final link failed: Bad value
   collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

wesm commented on issue #3472: ARROW-4358: [WIP] Skip updating mvn
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3472#issuecomment-457306757
 
 
   Haha, this is what I was talking about in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4343
   
   To use the conda-forge packages on Trusty you have to install some additional packages: `gcc_linux-64` and `gxx_linux-64`. gcc-4.8 can no longer be used together with the conda-forge packages
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pravindra commented on issue #3472: ARROW-4358: [CI] Restore support for trusty in CI
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3472#issuecomment-457794994
 
 
   @wesm, can you please review?
   
   Installing the gcc and gxx packages from Vonda-forge didn’t help - there were tonnes of linking errors. Maybe, it needs to be accompanied by some other step that I missed.
   
   Setting the conda forge label got the build working in both Travis CI and cross-bow (it also uses the same CI scripts).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

pravindra commented on pull request #3472: ARROW-4358: [CI] Restore support for trusty in CI
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3472#discussion_r251185536
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/travis_install_linux.sh
 ##########
 @@ -37,13 +37,13 @@ fi
 
 set -x
 
-sudo apt-get install -y -qq maven
+#sudo apt-get install -y -qq maven
 
 # Remove Travis-specific versions of Java
-sudo rm -rf /usr/local/lib/jvm*
-sudo rm -rf /usr/local/maven*
-hash -r
-unset JAVA_HOME
+#sudo rm -rf /usr/local/lib/jvm*
 
 Review comment:
   Done for both.

fields.description:
As a side effect of [https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/1b8a7bc3baa4bce660c18a13934115d55f8733df,] java builds on trusty are broken due to removal of travis maven in this commit.

This Jira is to support both environments..
